emuInput.TitMainTitle: Theresa A. Clarke holding Pittsburgh Courier Newspaper with headlines reading "Eartha Kitt in $2 million Suit!" and "2 Pittsburghers Nabbed at Derby," in newsstand in East Liberty station
emuInput.CatDescriptText: Cutline of image published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, May 15, 1954, pg. 5, reads: "Courier at Station News Stands - A new service for travelers, commuters and vacationists has been inaugurated with the placing of the Courier on news stands in railroad and bus stations in Pittsburgh. Couriers are also available are available at two news stands in Pennsylvania Station, Greyhound Bus Station, P&LE Station, South Side at Smithfield Street, and East Liberty Station.  The Courier is also available to residents in Pittsburgh at the news stands located at Sixth and Wylie, and the Old Post Office, Fourth and Smithfield.  The Courier is on sale at these places each Thursday afternoon.  Pictured above is Theresa A. Clarke, news stand clerk in East Liberty Station selling a copy of the Courier.  She advises to get your copy early, since they sell very rapidly. - Harris Photo."
